title: Lisa Marie Presley's Portion Of The Elvis Music Fortune Was Already Worth $71 Million Over 10 Years Ago
text:
Lisa Marie Presley is still battling her ex-husband in their divorce, and recently it was revealed just how much was on the line when she tied the knot in 2007.

According to legal documents, obtained by The Blast, Lisa Marie and Michael Lockwood entered into a post-nuptial agreement after they were married over 10 years ago.

Related:

Lisa Marie Presley Says She Is "Financially Devastated" After $100 Million Elvis Fortune Goes Up In Smoke

Lisa Marie Presley Accuses Ex-Manager of Harassing Her Over Elvis Money in $100 Million Battle

Lisa Marie Presley's Elvis Money At Center of $100 Million Battle With Ex-Manager

Lisa Marie Presley Moves To Block Subpoenas Over Elvis Presley Money in $100 Million Battle

Elvis Presley's Daughter Lisa Marie Owes Almost a Half Million Dollars in Back Taxes

The Fortune

In the agreement, her portion of the Elvis Presley music fortune is worth an astounding $71,663,382.

Her attorneys, at the time, laid out the agreement to make sure her money was protected if the couple ever got divorced, as they did years later.

2007 Marriage

The document also reveals her new husband was broke.

The parties were married on January 22, 2006 in Kyoto, Japan and are still married to each other.

"Wife is 39 years old and has been previously married three times. She is the mother of two children, Danielle Riley Keough (date of birth May 29, 1989), and Benjamin Keough (date of birth October 21, 1992). Husband is 45 years old. He has not previously been married and has no children," the agreement reads.

It continues, "Wife is a woman of substantial means. Husband is a professional musician and producer with negative net worth."

The Agreement
